text: Tap at the Brewpub, 2nd May 17. Pours black, slick. Aroma is dark chocolate, smoked bacon. Taste is rich intergrated smoke, dark chocolate, coffee. Very tasty stuff.
Tap at Brlirrofico Lambrate. Dark, but not jet black. Smoked, chocolated. Smooth, velvet, pleasant aftertaste. Good one.

Bottle 
Appearance: completely dark, with a nice head 
Aroma: beckon crisps, juicy ham (while smelling one would like to eat it), dark malts, roasted notes, coffee like. All together make definitely pleasant aroma 
Taste: some sweetness, roasted, dry, dark bread finish, some milk like notes (diacetyl?) 
Smokiness is much more stronger in aroma then in taste. One would like to have it more in the taste. The beer resembles more stout then Baltic porter.

W aromacie przyjemne nuty szynkowe, troszkę kwaśności z ciemnych słodów, oraz mleczna czekolada (chyba diacetyl). W smaku ciało średnie, bardzo palone, wręcz kwaskowate od ciemnych słodów, nuty szynkowe, mleczna kawa. Generalnie fajne piwo, chociaż bliżej mu do stouta niż do portera

Draught at Open Baladin Torino. Pours opaque black with a medium, creamy tan head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is heavy roast malt, smoked wood, prunes and moderate earthy hops. Flavor is smoked wood, heavy roast and chocolate malt, moderate earthy hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

strong aroma - a lot of roasted malt, roasted coffee, moderate smoky, dark chocolate, a bit of sourness.
medium, to strong, and dry taste - burnt malt, moderate smoky, roasted coffee, some dark chocolate, pleasant hops bitterness in the final, some ash. wonderful beer!

BOTTLE 33 CL. Opaque black, creamy mocha head. Really smoky nose, dominating the malts, quite a bit of green peppery hops. Thick creamy mouthfeel with quite a bit of dark malt sweetness, that is however really well balanced by the smoke and the strong grassy/peppery pungent bitterness. Maybe too strong.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. 2009 vintage, 1st batch. Niesamowicie ułożone, owocowe, czekoladowe, bogate. Ma Che Siete 4 life!

0,33l bottle at home from trade with lordrakos, big thanks for this one. BB 09/10/2019. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells earthy, dusty, some dried fruits, bacon, dried meat, nutty, marzipan, spices. quite nice smell, not as bold as other smoked beers though. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes earthy, licorice, spices, light bacon, bitter chocolate, some coffee, light herbal. finishes light to medium dry with earthy notes, bacon and light coffee. very nice one, not as bold as other smoked beers, but definitly very enjoyable. gets a bit vanilla-ish once it warms up, but does not distract so much from the overall enjoyment.

Black, almost opaque.

Aroma: smoked, coffee, berries, charcoal.
Moderate sweet, prominent bitterness.
Flavour: burned robusta, smoked beacon, bread, some earthy and woody notes.

Good.

Bottle. Pours deep dark brown with small pale brown head. Aroma: roasted, smoked fish, chocolate, weak coffee, dark plums. Taste: smoked fish skin, weak sourness, bitter chocolate and milk chocolate also, Full body. Nice beer.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BB 040221, at Koht, 20160711) The beer poured black. Its head was small and lightly brown. Aroma had burnt malts, chocolate, smoke and sweetness. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were burnt malts, smoke, sweetness, grass and bitterness. Aftertaste was smoky, burnt and bitter. A pretty good smoky and strong brew.

samaan aikaan tuiman paahteinen mutta silti pehmeä. savuisuus varmaankin turvemaltaasta eli enemmän turpeisuutta kuin rehellistä savuisuutta. melkoa makea, huulet jää lasiin kiinni. erittäin hyvä. joutui pitkään punnitsemaan 8 ja 9 välillä niin tuoksussa kuin maussakin mutta ehkä sellainen viimeinen silaus jäi vielä uupumaan
Bottle from uba ja humal, tallinn. Black color, brown head. Lots of smoke on nose, some coffee. Full body, smoke, coffee. Good balance with smoke.

Bottle in Portland. Soap bubbles, tan foam, lovely dirty beer, ruddy. Deep sweet, mellow red fruit depths, sweet leather. Turkish coffee, grainy coffee bean residuals. Vegetal notes on aroma. Full, delicious, robust and ruddy. Great! Thanks Alberto.
Draught. Dark chocolate and plums, complemented by coffee and topped off with a not overbearing amount of peat. Soft, balanced, very tasty beer.

Bottle at a tasting in Portland-Oregon, many thanks to douglas88 for hosting and offering. Rough dark brown pour, unstable tan head. Nose: leather, mint elements and some smoke. Mouth: more rough notes, wild Imp Stout, some dry fruit, smoke again. Lovely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 ounce bottle thanks to Alberto. Pours a dark brown black color with a small white head. A big sweet minty chocolate nose. The flavor is dry cocoa, anise. Very good.
Bottle 0,33l from Hops Beer Shop in Trieste. Dark liquid, beige head. Full body, medium carbonation. Smoked smell, taste is smoked, creamy.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2016 Very dark brown color, almost black, average sized tan head. Aroma of smoked malt, ham, roasted malt. Taste of smoke, roasted malt, herbs, dark chocolate, coffee, slightly watery... Maybe due to drinking it after 10% RIS. Bitter, maybe even too bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation. Good but expected even more.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

appearance: black with small bubble foam
aroma: perfume , liquorice
taste: roasted malt with a little alcohol
beer is balanced between roasted malt and sweetness left.

quite nice but not perfect to much roast aftertaste

330ml bottle. Very dark brown, almost black color. Medium size, brown head, stays. Woody, bit smoked, caramel, very faint toffee, alcohol in aroma. Sweet, woody, smoked, faint sausage, herbal hops in taste. Woody, fatty sausage and nettley hops in aftertaste. Covers alcohol well. Fatty sausages are nice. Hops are maybe bit too acidic, but actually wont ruin anything. Nice one.

Bottle (from Koht). Pours dark brown with beige-light brown head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is smoke, malt. Flavor is sweet, smoke, malt, tar. Carbonation is on the low side. Finish is tar and roast. Overall: nice enough.
Dark brown color; quite nice beige head. Roasted aroma, dried fruits, ash and smoked notes. Dry taste, strong roastness and ash. high roasted bitterness.

Bottle; BB 2021. Pours dark brown with moderate tan head. The aromas rather restrained smokiness and roasted malts, some pissy and earthy notes. Tastes sweet with a sour overcoat and warming bitter finish. Flavours smoky and roasty, chocolate and coffee. Doesnt seem all too clean though. Pretty flat on the palate with little carbonation in the finish together with the slightly biting bitterness. Somewhat sticky. I quite like the smoky character of this, I normally dont like smoked beers at all, especially when the smokiness recalls greasy sausages - here the smokiness is better integrated with the roast of the malts I think. Its quite nice.

Aromat: Delikatna wędzoność, szynka, słodycz i alkohol (po ogrzaniu)
Wygląd: Czarne, z piękną beżową pianą
Smak: Wybijają się przyjemne wędzonki typu ogniskowego i szynkowego wraz z akompaniamentem słodkiej czekolady oraz kawy, całość jest bardzo dobrze zrównoważona, tak, że żadna ze stron nie przeważa. Pełni dodaje dobre ciało oraz miła degustacyjność odpowiadająca parametrom piwa.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2016 Smoked, some leather, huge brown head quite persistant, pitch black, great mouthfeel, medium/full body, law/medium carbonation, good smoked sensations and strong notes of choco/coffee...hey man, don?t worry i?d only like to get in that pub.
On tap at BBF. Black colour with beige head. Mild smoked aroma. Smoked, roasted taste. Medium body.

Bottle. Black, brown top. Roasted coffee on nose, woody dark malty, slight tar. Med full bodied, smooth nice, pretty easy for the abv. Dark dry chcolate, or powder chocolate, light ash astribgency in finish. Pretty nice drink. Feels wholesome,cin balance.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2016 On tap. Color ebano, testa schiumosa e carbonata color caffé abbastanza duratura. Olfatto poco generoso e affumicato. Carbonazione persistente e vivace.
Corpo medio, un po watery, che comunque dona una ottima scorrevolezza alla beva. Nota palatale piccante e piacevolmente
affumicata, con ai lati note di torba, legno e catrame. Laroma smoked glissa dolcemente fino a sublimarsi nellamaro intenso ed alcoolico del finale lungo, soddisfacentemente robusto e sempre
dinamicamente carbonato. Fa ricordare di sè questa ottima baltic porter affumicata con la sua carbonazione sempre attiva che ne esalta le singole
componenti la rende perfettamente tenuta insieme.

Bottle 
Aroma-smoke, chocolate, caramel, 
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, lightly sour, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 26-10-20. ciemny braz z niebrzydka, niewysoka, ladnie brudzaca szklo piana. w aromatach jest kawa, czekolada, jakies ciemne suszone owoce, nieco miesna wedzonka i palonosc. w ustach jest kwaskowate, slodkawe a dalej jak w aromatach. niestety tez chyba jeszzcze sie nie poukladalo - alkoholowosc malo sympatyczna, malo szlachetna, choc na szczescie nie nachalna. goryczka stosunkowo wysoka. dosc niemile kwaskowato-alkoholowe posmaki. za to bardzo mila faktura, dosc pelne i dosc gladkie, takie atłasowe odczucie. sumarycznie jest dobre ale nic ponad to. no i wole w efekcie lekka, nieimperialna wersje GhizyOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

On tap at Uiltje bar, Haarlem. Dark with a beige head. Sweet aroma of malts, roasted, smoke, caramel. Taste is bitter sweet, roastedness, smoke, ash, bitter ending. Aftertaste of bitter hard roasted malts and smoke. Not bad.
Butelka 0,33l Kolor czarny, piany niestety brak. Aromat słodowy, trochę suszu śliwkowego. Smak gorzkiej kawy. Goryczka średnia, ładnie ułożone piwo.
Draft at Craft & Draft. Aroma of mild smoke, roasted malt, subtle ham and coffee. Flavor of cream, smoke, bitter coffee, licorice and bitter passion fruit. Nice smoke beer, not very intense though.

Bottle @ Hotel Florence, Milan, Italy. Pours pitch black with a huge creamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, caramel, smoke, smoked ham, burnt caramel, dark chocolate. Flavor is light sweet, rich malty, caramel, slightly burnt, smoked meat, dark chocolate, toasted bread, some dark fruit notes, little alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, light sweet finish with some warming alcohol. 121215

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2016 Birra scurissima, molto densa, schiuma color cappuccino. Aroma prevalentemente affumicato, al palato è  un pó meno densa di come si può immaginare. L'amaro deciso sul finale ripulisce la bocca e agevola molto la bevuta. L'affumicato resiste fino a quando la birra non si scalda un po', lasciando emergere sapori tostati e di caffè, più congeniali per una imperial stout.
Aroma: coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, whisky. Taste: coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate, toffee, whisky and dried plums. Medium head, good lacing and medium carbonation.

1.5dl on tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam. Body is pitch black, head is big, brownish, creamy rocky, fully lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is slightly smoky, roasted malt, flavor is roasted malt, mild coffee, chocolate, dried fruits. Medium sweet, medium to heavy roasty bitter. Finish is medium lasting roasty medium to heavy bittersweet. Medium body, dry texture, soft carbonation. Easy dessert beer, simple, good one.

Aroma: buttery, toasted malts, some cacao, light coffee. Appearance: black, medium, creamy, beige head. Taste: medium sweet and biter. Palate: initially heavy on sweet malts, caramel, toasted flavours, lightly smoked, turns very bitter and dry in the finish. Overall: outstanding Smoked Porter, beautiful palate, if anything, maybe a touch light on the smoke. Pint at The Italian Job, Chiswick.

On tap @ Brassigaume. Dark black colour with a nice tan head. Roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate and liquorice in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium to full body. Taste is quite balanced and the smoked notes are well masked into the flavour. Maybe a bit too carbonated. Overall, a very good beer.

Bevuta a Roma alla spina. Il colore è scuro, bella schiuma scura e cremosa. Al naso si si sente aroma affumicato e liquirizia. Il sapore è pieno. Decisamente una birra che scalda da bere con calma. birra ottima

Sehr dunkel orange braunes Bier mit einer schönen bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, rauchig, Schinken, Kaffee. Geschmack sehr rauchig, viel Schinken, kräftig röstmalzig, Schokolade, Kaffee, bitter hopfig, nicht schlecht!

Cask, @Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Roma. 21/09/2015
Color negro, espuma beige, aroma tostado, sabor maltoso, dulce, cuerpo medio.
Beczka. Barwa czarna, Piana brązowa, drobna, słabo utrzymująca się. Aromat palonych słodów, śliwki. W smaku kawa, palone słody, śliwki. Alkohol dobrze ukryty, Goryczka, niewysoka, Wysycenie niskie.

Kran/Tap: 300ml - Pub Pułapka - Gdańsk - Poland,
The term drinking/Termin wypicia: 1.08.2015, 
Kolor/Color: czarny, nieprzejrzysty (ale mogę się mylić, późno było i sporo piw już wypitych),
Piana/Foam: beżowa, drobna, dość obfita, z tego co pamiętam i zapisałem oblepiała całkiem ładnie szkło, 
Zapach/Aroma: jest wędzonka to fakt - ale nie jest na jakimś mega intensywnym poziomie, jest też wyraźna paloność kawy i śliwkowe nuty, trochę alkoholu w postaci nut likieru, 
Smak/Taste: tu też wędzonka nie jest intensywna i niej est na pierwszym planie, bardziej do głosu dochodzą palone słody, czekolada, kawa, lukrecja (czarne haribo), goryczka - średnia - zalegająca, i tyle zapisałem i zapamiętałem, piwo ogólnie bardzo mi smakowało i chętnie bym się go napił jeszcze raz, bo nie ukrywam to było już 10 piwo tego wieczoru,
Wysycenie/Carbonation: średnie - odpowiednie, 
Opakowanie/Package: eta na nalewaku spoko,

Piana drobna, kawowa. 
Kolor czarny. W aromacie lekkie nuty wędzone, plus wyraźne nuty śliwkowe. Trochę nut palonych. Lekko wyczuwalny alkohol, daje nuty likierowe. 
W smaku dość wytrawne.
W smaku wyczuwalna alkoholowa goryczka, grzeje w przełyku.
Jest wyraźnie zarysowany, ale nie przeszkadza. Znów wędzoność i śliwki. Nuty gorzkiej czekolady. Słodycz praktycznie nieobecna. Kwaskowe nuty ciemnych słodów. 
Gęste w odczuciu, pełne.
Piłem wczoraj (Pułapka, Gdańsk) i smakowało, ale dziś w pamięci nie pozostał żaden charakterystyczny ślad sensoryczny.

Tap at Braufest Berlin 2015. Medium carbonation dark pour aromas smoked bacon liquorice coffee caramel the flavours medium bitter fruit rich dark taste smoked goodness sweet caramel roast coffee rich dark chocolate sweet liquorice a true Baltic
Had on cask. Pours a dark black with ran bubbly head. A very strong smoky aroma. Taste is meaty and smoky with malts and coffee. That smoky meat taste definitely lingers.

Black, thick head. 
Smoky, coffee, smoked ham, Schwarzbrot. 
Smoked, harmonically bitter, stays quite a time on the palate.

Pours black with nice head, leaving a nice lacing. Aroma: elegant smoke aroma coupled with dried plum and roastiness. Taste: very well balanced with roastiness, some smoke, a touch of bitterness and a hoppy palate. Medium carbonation. Elegant and well balanced beer. Very drinkable, also because the ABV is very well hidden. This is an American-styled super drinkable porter rather than an imperial porter heavyweight. Still very good.

Marrone scuro, schiuma marroncina molto persistente. Aroma vivace di affumicato e liquirizia. Al palato si conferma la liquirizia, un affumicato deciso ma non così tendente al bacon, cacao, nel complesso amaro. Birra interessante e di un buon equilibrio. Alcol del tutto nascosto.
Intensywna beżowa piana oblepia szkło. W aromacie wędzonka, palona kawa. W smaku kawa i wyczuwana lukrecja. Piwo pełne, niskowysycone. Dość pijalne. Goryczka zalegająca.

Bottle @ Warsaw Beer Festival. Pours black, off-white head. Aroma of chocolate, dark fruit, some hints of smokiness. In taste its nicely balanced, with evident porter-ish sweetness. Very drinkable, but could be a bit more smoky.

Bardzo dobre piwo. Aromat jest ok, choć tej wędzonki nie czuć zbyt intensywnie. Tak samo w smaku - wędzonka nie dominuje. Pochwalić za to trzeba wygląd i pianę (piana jak śmietana). Jedno z lepszych piw jakie piłem na Warszawskim Festiwalu Piwa.
Clear black, almost no chocolate head. Complex aroma. Roasted notes, milk chocolate, cream, toffee, riped fruit, nuts, blueberries. Rich dry taste with burnt wiod, smoky notes, cocoa bean, passito.

Baltic Porter che sinceramente non mi è sembrata un gran che. Presenta pochi sapori (tra i quali sentori di vernice), e tende decisamente allamaro, ma un amaro che stride. Interessante, ma sicuramente sopravvalutata.

33cl bottle. Pours black with a beautiful creamy beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee and a milky sweetness. Taste is roasted malts, light coffee, some smoke, earthy notes, faint alcoholic warmness. Very good final bitterness with ground coffee and bitter chocolate notes. Full body, light carbonation. Excellent.

Bottle @ La compagnia del Luppolo. Birra marrone, opalescente, con schiuma beige fine e persistente. Aroma intenso, tostato, affumicato, alcolico di frutti rossi sotto spirito, cacao amaro. Complesso ed intrigante. Gusto dapprima abboccato, alcolico, poi emergono le note tostate, mai eccessive durante la bevuta. Quando la temperatura della birra sale , la si può apprezzare nella sua completa dolcezza alcolica, e lamaro viene mitigato. Perfettamente equilibrata, dal gusto complicato, ma remunerativo. Piena, rotonda corposa.

Coal black with bubbly brown head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee (good coffee) and a little bit of smoke. taste, is great, loads of malt, chocolate. Not much smoke. Slick at first and then drying. Fantastic beer.

330 ml bottle from Les Vignerons. Pitch black, no light passing through, with a tiny, bubbly, non persistent light beige head. Mainly chocolate and smoked malts on the nose, coffee beans, slightly meaty and a hint of vanilla as well. Little alchool edge, but not too much. Pretty high bitterness, slick and oily but not too heavy, the aftertaste really linger forever. Dark chocolate, light smoke, some darker type of fruits and a hint of alchool. Crazy drinkability. Soft to average carbonation, medium to full body, oily texture. Fantastic.
A great brew. Really nice cocoa smokiness, and the toffee sets up the mellowing. Then the alcohol comes through and slight bourbon oakiness. A great brew form Italy.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2014 Draught @ Ma che Sieta Venuti A Fa, Rome; pours deep brown to black with danse, dark beige head. Nose is complex, rich of chocolate, dark fruit and roasted malts aromas, with smoky, tobacco and alcohol hints. Taste is similar to the aroma, lots of roasted malt, chocolate and dark fruits. Nice bitter finish. Im not such a big fan of a smoked beer, but I like this, well balanced beer a lot. Smoky taste notes are coming out just in aftertaste, along with a hop bitternes and they are not to much noticable. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Nice brew!

330 ml bottle. Pours a black colour with a small beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, smoked wood, salty licorice and biscuit. Rich flavour of roasted malts, chocolate, smoked wood and floral notes. I really like the wooden notes here. Full bodied, oily mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Well balanced.

33 cl bottle @ home. Batch #079: BBE 08.02.2015
Loaf bread aroma when pouring. Closer sniff: loaf bread, rye pudding, smoked ham and hints of licorice. Flavour has rye pudding, smoky tones, licorice and hints of peat. If a smoked rye pudding would exist, this could be the beer interpretation of it. Too sweet to be enjoyable in big amounts, but works as a slow sipper.
botttled and shared wioth veliemboys. joku väri jkpok iuj maku djoetu oiz gayt angastajg o jggjggjdfxcvjkgbsdflgjbsrd,

33 cl bottle.
Pours dark brown color with a small beige head. Aroma of faint smoke, peat, some vanilla, dark malts, some grain and caramel notes. Flavor of caramel malts, wood, dried fruits, some ham and faint licorice. Nice and quite interesting.
3314

330ml bottle from De Molen Beershop

Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma of smoked malts, roastiness, hints of syrup and licorice. Taste is smooth, roasty and mildly smoked with some syrup, licorice, dark chocolate and coffee. Finish is sweetish, roasty and syrupy with hints of wood, dark chocolate and licorice. Quite balanced Baltic porter with hints of smoked malts.

Bottle. Pours black with a tiny brown head. In aroma mainly notes of coffee and prunes, also little dark chocolate and hint of alcohol. In taste similar: coffee and prunes. Carbonation is low, full bodied, medium bitterness, oily, nice texture, leaves pleasant feeling on the tongue. Very small hint of alcohol. Very rich and good beer.

Bottle. In aroma coffee, chocolate, licorice, prunes and unfortunately only hint of smokiness. The beer is black with brown not lasting long head. In taste there is coffee, chocolate, smokiness in slightly higher level than in aroma and some roasted malts. The beer has full body, is oily, medium carbonation. The finish is medium bitter. In overal very good beer but, it would be better with more smoke notes.

Very dark brown. Thin bubbly head. Has a baltic nose, rich meaty and chocolatey, a big beer. Rich, smoky, intense...zywiec level richness...balanced with smoke, cigars, a bit of fudge, the rich sugary bitterness of Okinawan black sugar. This is high quality stuff.
Tried it at brewhouse 137. Very dark with a distinct smokey taste. Great rating overall, an outstanding beer!
33cl bottle at brewhouse 137. Pours black with little head. Smokey aroma and taste. Bitter, roasted with coffee and lots of smoke through out. Ok, but a bit smokey for me

33 cl bottle, thanks Alex! Marked L008 12, dated (BB) 05 04 15. Sampled on March 12, 2014.Black color, medium sized dark brown head with lots of bubbles. Sweet, rich, smoked, chocolate, rasin, figs scent, also wet pipe tobacco, very nice. Sweet, roasted, chocolate, cocoa, alcohol, vinous, tobacco taste. Roasted, malty, coffee, some dark chocolate aftertaste. Medium to smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness that is to the dry side and feels a bit higher I think due to a roasted dry finish.

At a tasting, thanks Ariel, opaque black colour, small bubbly brown head, aroma of dark sourdough bread, chocolate, dark dried fruits, hints of barnyard and smoke, dominant flavour of flavour of raisins and prunes, a bit to much,with chocolate, charred notes and some dirt, quite sour which throws the beer a little of balance. Pretty nice but not great.

Bottle at Bishops Arms Järntorget, Göteborg. Pitch black beer with a small brownish/dark beige head. Malty vanilla aroma, hazelnuts, caramel, roasted, milk chocolate, smoked notes, ash, roasted coffee flavor, tar, ash, raisins, figs, smoked notes, alcohol is well hidden. Maybe a bit thin bodied, but a really good beer.

aroma smoke and coffee
App black tan head
Flavour extreme smoke with malt and coffee

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Cardinal. Pours a black body with a brown head. Good lqcing. Liquorice and coffee on the nose. Full bodied and smooth. Pungent burnt raisins, liquorice and smoke in the mouth. Sweet and roasted with a long pleasant finish that reveals the bitterness. Pretty good stuff.

On tap @ Cardinal. Pitch black body with a thin, lacing beige head. Nice, but not very strong aroma of dark, roasted malt with a hint of coffee. Did not find any smoke at first, but after sipping a bit and warming up the glass a bit its definitively some smoke here. Flavor has dark roasted malt, mellow smoke, coffee, dark chocolate and a hint of liquorice. Nice body and pleasant aftertaste. A very nice, and easy drinkable moderate smoked porter.

Fra fad på Cardinaltreff feb-14: så å si uten skum (tross kompetent oppskjenking). Aroma av hjemmelagde kokosmakroner. I smaken finner jeg bitter, mørk sjokolade og tørr lakris med antydning av røyk. Skarp ettersmak. Stor kontrast mellom aroma og smak. Tørr. Ikke helt lett å bli klok på - denne må prøves igjen.
Very dark brown, little head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate and cocoa. Roasted malt is well balanced with bitterness. Fine aftertaste.

On tap at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Black colour, low beige head. Aroma of smoked malts / smoked sausage, with fruity hops in the background. Light bodied and refreshing for its strength. The fairly dry flavour is smoked, but not extreme, with decent hops throughout, and a spicy warming finish, reminiscent of chipotle.

Spina @ le birre della merla 2014.
Scura con schiuma eterna.
Già al naso salta fuori laffumicato.
Difficile, complessa, corpo setoso e pieno.
Affumicata con buone tostature.
Bevuta un pò di corsa, da riprovare con calma.

Troche mnie zawiodlo to piwo. Baltycki porter podwedzany, co oni jeszcze nie wymysla? Piwo czarne i geste bez zadnej piany, alkoholowa nuta w koncowce, palonosc na przyzwoitym poziomie, wedzenia srednio tu wyczulem. Po przelknieciu przyjemna wytrawna koncowka. Ale podstawowa Ghisa o wiele, wiele mi bardziej przypadla do gustu, chocby przez sama piane. Polecam ale do rozwagi przy zakupie.

tape @green river. bella schiuma cappuccinosa nero notte. lalcol si sente aroma affumicato e liquerizia. sapore pieno che si espande si sentono i malti ben bilanciati dallamaro del luppolo. birra ottima

10-NOV-2013, tap @Green River in Bologna.
Black with lasting tan head.
Aroma is smoke, roast, burnt malt, grape fruit. Taste the same. Very hoppy. Smoke is just an addition to the complex porter. Very fine brew.
Full body and medium carbonation. Could drink a lot of this.

Schwarz, schöne beige schaumkrone, aroma: cafe, caramel, leichte rauchnote / antrunk: gehaltvoll, malzig und feinherb/ nachklang: feinherb/ feine rezenz

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle the in-laws brought me back from the brewtap. Slim-necked tar with a grey-tan collar. Aroma of chorizo, deep black cocoa-heavy chocolate, sticky dried fruit, berries, filter coffee. Deep and burnt with robust black coffee bitterness, swirls of cocoa and berries; charred veg. Moussey condition, unobtrusive alcohol, hints of soapy hop. Good but cant touch standard issue Ghisa.

Medium sized tan head soft medium carbonation dark pour aromas smoked bacon liquorice coffee caramel the flavours medium bitter fruit rich dark taste smoked goodness sweet caramel roast coffee rich dark chocolate sweet liquorice a true Baltic in taste so tasteful the finish best of flavours rich malts sweetness smoked and bitter lingering tastes very nice

The colour of a flying fox - just somehow I happen to be tasting this in Canberra, Australia. Lovely dark russet almost black, with a a russet head that does not last too long. Aroma of gruen Speck. Flavour is rather weak in general, with dark chocolates, plenty of plums, grapefruit, a dry, bitter finish, but hardly any smokiness, except for the bacon. Medium bodied, with an oily feel. All aspects are not bad on their own, but the overall experience is not as rewarding as I had hoped. A Baltic Porter? Perhaps more of a Lombard Porter.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2013 Black syrup - surprising for a porter. Aroma is smokey vege extract (vegemite) and as it warms, cabana meat. Taste is nice - full flavoured, thick mouthfeel, dark roast, smokiness at the end. Palate is a malty smokey tang. Overall, a nice imperial baltic porter.

Bottle with a fantastic label. Pours pitch black with no head to speak of. Aroma is sweet with molasses and some alcohol, but also hard roasted malts, smoke and coffee. In the taste the smoke is much more pronounced than in the aroma, but still very nicely balanced with the roasted malts, coffee and some cacoa. Medium bitter finish with a lingering taste of smoke and coffee. Very soft carbo and a very full body which give the beer a fantastic mouthfeel. Great beer.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks DSG. Pours black to brown with a brown head, aroma of pepperoni, paprika, smoke, surprising, flavor of wood, smoked wood, smoked sausage, nice sweetness, medium to full bodied, great

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks DSG.Black. Wood, sausage and chocolate aroma that actually go together quite well, a little wooden taste thats smoky, inky and rich. Syrupy and sticky texture, no carbonation, smoky and a little ashen aftertaste.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Black with a brown head, Great aroma full of smoked sausages, roastiness, chocolate and some saltiness. Sweetish and smoky flavor with sausages, chocolate, a bit of roastiness and a dry finish. Medium to full-bodied. Excellent.

Black colour, tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, smoke and caramel. Bitter flavour, ash, smoke, chocolate and liquorice. Bitter finish, roasted malts.
Nice brew!
(From 33cL bottle @ ZZT VI. 8.5% ABV. Courtesy of IluvatarMilan. Thanks for sharing, Milan!)

Bottle @ Kiss The Kitchen Floor or better known as ZZT VI (2013): kindly shared by IluvatarMilan: 
Medium to smaller sized brown head which disappears completely and leaves nothing on top of a black colored beer. 
The aroma is deep dark roast with liquorice, oatmeal and roasted rice.
The flavour is bitter with oatmeal, roast, dark chocolate, liquorice and the bitterness keeps gentle growing.
Aftertaste is bitter with roast and bay leaf.
Low carbo, soft close to silky mouthfeel, full body and an oily texture.
Balanced, deep and smooth.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Zzt bottle. Pitch black body with red hue. Intense aroma of roasted malts, a hint of smoke. Taste is very concentrated but balanced. Also some dark chocolate and liquorice wood.

Sampled from bottle @ ZZT VI. Opaque pitch black color, no head. Smell malts, lightly coffee, a hint of chocolate. Taste malts, coffee, bitterness, roastyness. Very nice! Medium to full body, medium carbonation.

Bottle @ ZZT VI thx to illuvatarmilan. Pitch black oily with no head. Smells sweet, roasty, dark chocolate, slightly smokey, some bacon. Tastes roasty, coffee, dark chocolate, slightly bacon, slightly smokey. Better than the regular Ghisa. Full body, silky, soft carbo, lasting aftertaste.

Black, brown/white foam. Sweet nose, very complex. This beer reminds me a bit of coke: sour and sweet. Bitter finish: burnt malts, dark chocolat and coffee. Almost no smoke. The aftertaste isnt very long.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2013 aroma:bread, chocolate, coffee, toast, roasty, alcohol, 
apparenza: black, hazy, minimal head, 
gusto: light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
palato: light body, sticky, lively, long finish, 
per celebrare la mia CENTESIMA birra su ratebeer mi sono concesso questa spettacolare smoked baltic porter,bevuta al pub lambrate a milano col magico ciccio! questa birra ha vinto molti premi e capisco perchè..aroma clamoroso,misto di malti affumicati,caffè,aroma da porter del quale non mi intendo molto ma riconosco la complessità..gusto da birra complessa,in stile stout ma con un misto affumicato-amaro veramente speciale..dal nome e dallo stile ci si aspetterebbe una birra corposa da meditazione,invece il corpo snello e la secchezza la fanno scendere giù che è un piacere,quindi un pregio/difetto se vogliamo!

Aspetto nero impenetrabile con schiuma marrone piuttosto persistente...aroma di caffè tostato, cioccolato amaro e terra bruciata...sensazione che ritroviamo in bocca, con un corpo importante e un alcolico presente ma non invadente. Finale amaro ben bilanciato e medio-lungo. Davvero ottima!
Bottle. Color dark black with almost no head. Aroma malt, roasted, coffee, chocolate, smoke?. Taste sweet, bitter cocoa, caramel, bitter aftertaste.

33cl bottle bought at Brassigaume 2012.
Noire, col moyen moka, le tout huileux sur le verre.
Arôme présente un bouquet profond de malt avec un côté noisette/farine, chocolaté, caramel et fumé très subtile.
Palais est épais sur une effervescence très faible qui rajoute à ce palais épais et huileux. Note un bon profil malté chocolaté presque de toffee avec un malt fumé qui suit sans pour cela dominer toute lexpérience mais contribue à développer une bière bien fumée. Pointe dépice entre poivré venant peut-être de la levure et houblons. 

Point positif pour létiquette qui me rappelle le jeu Dishonored, côté rétro-post moderne.
@ birrificio lambrate. It pours black like the darkness without head on top. Cocoa, roast and smoked at nose and in mouth. Good balanced in bitterness. A great beer!

33 cl. fles thuis  gekocht tijdens Brassigaume 2012  zwart maar niet het donkerste zwart bedenkbaar, amper kraag  ruikt naar gerookte mout, houtskool, zware inkt, sojasaus en een lichte chocolade end pikzwarte chocolade toets  smaakt naar echt veel inkt, houtskool, redelijk tot zwaar verbrande spek, echt veel kampvuur een verkoold hout, sojasous, aarde / turf-achtig, redelijk gerookt, heel dikke vleesjus met een drop toets  beetje dik, weinig tot geen koolzuur  iets extremer, lichtjes apart, wel leuk, dat wel maar niet al te gemakkelijk om te drinken  dit heeft wel een van de COOLSTE labels OOIT

Bottle, shared october 20th 2012. All black beer, big beige head. Soft carbonation, thick body. Fruity and smoky aroma, with rubber and chocolate, a bit different. Good massive roasted taste, smoke hints, bitter mocca, very nice. Finishes bitter with dark chocolate and coffee.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 Impenetrabile color nero oleoso pressochè privo di schiuma, giusto un tenue velo color panna poco persistente. Aroma ricco e robusto con sentori di cacao, mou e frutti di bosco, e una più lieve parvenza fumosa. Gusto dolciastro e maltoso con note persistenti di caffè e zucchero caramellato ben bilanciate con laffumicatura abbondante, finale "pulito" con morbide note debolmente nocciolate. Oleosa al palato, di corpo medio-abbondante e con effervescenza quasi nulla: una fantastica ed intensa birra da meditazione!

21/07 RBESG Grand Tasting, 0.33 l bottle I believe. It poured very dark brown, almost black body with medium sized brown head. Complex aroma, peaty, dusty, full roasted malty with nice citrus hops that were not too prominent. Flavor was sweet, slightly bitter, coffee, chocolate, roaster sugar, herbal hoppy and spicy licorice. Smoked character was weak, I added something here but cant decipher my notes. Full in body with long finish. A robust beer that was a pleasure to have.

RBESG 12, Bratislava. Grand Tasting at Richtar Jakub. 33cl Bottle. Black colour, thin brown head. Aroma of hard roasted malts, tar, some green chili, chocolate. Flavour follows, with quite some hard roasted and tarry notes. Almost fullbodied. Really nice.

Bottle @ RBESG Grand Tasting 2012. Black appearance with a very small brown head. Anise, raisin, richly roasty, dark chocolate, charred aroma. Burnt/charred, lightly smoky, dark chocolate malty, black licorice, burnt flavor. Good stuff

RBESG GT 2012. Poured a brown body with an off white head. Sweet and dusty, malty aroma with notes of orange. Nice roasty notes, herbal aroma hops,  coffee, caramel, damn good overall. Strong and thats all I can decypher. Nice!

RBESG 2012 Grand tasting. Dark brown colour, almost black. Aroma peat, smoke, wood. Taste very smooth medium to heavy bitter, medium tart, roasted, . Extremely drinkable, finish medium bitter, medium sweet. Another highlight of the evening, I will surely come back to this one.
RBESG Grand Tasting. Black color with small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, dried black fruit, smoke. Taste, roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, smoke, alcohol. Nice.

RBESG Grand Tasting. Black with a small tan head. Aroma of licorice, dark dried fruit, malt and a touch of ink. Sweet malty flavour with lots of roasted notes and a touch of smoke. A bit one-dimensional....

Bottle 33 cl. Pours pitch black with a medium tan head and an aroma of ripe cherries, smoked eel and some malts. The taste is sweet and mainly dominated by the smoke, but also his notes of strong black coffee and dark bitter chocolate and theres a lingering bitterness in the end. A really nice beer, would drink this again.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2016 330ml bottle - shared by Mirjukka and Janne - thanks! (8:5:8:4:15=4.0)
Jet black, large tight chocolatey head, very sticky. Rich bacony roast aroma, sweet and hammy. Lovely rich roast taste, just a bit of an ashy edge. Otherwise a smooth palate, and with gentle carbonation. Bitter espresso later taste. Finish has just a hint of the ham from earlier, and a slightly metallic burnt ashy bite. Covers the 8.5% well, it just feels big, not boozy. Slightly oily palate and finish. A stormer - many thanks Mirjukka and Janne.
Rerate: 330ml bottle - Thanks Kairi! (7:4:8:4:14=3.7)
Oh, thats lovely. Sweet and roasty aroma. Taste brings a lovely smoky aspect to the mix. Full palate, pleasantly carbonated. Enough flavour to completely cover the alcohol. Smokiness nice and sweet in the finish. Bitter hops drying, and make you want more. Still bloody good, but not the wow from last time.

Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is hops, liquorice, molasses, slight medicinal, touch of smoky peat. Flavour is liquorice, ashy roast, slight medicinal, burned malt. Very roasty and ashy, lingers on and on. Nice.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2012 Black bodied, no real head. Very developed rich flavour, chocolate covered cherry, medical, cough syrop, toast. Solid sweet taste, some smoke. Bit of sharpness in the end. Like it. (33cl bottle, at dEnk house tasting)

Bottle at mini-dEnk tasting. Black pour, thin tan head. Aroma is roasted, smoked, ashy and burnt. Flavor is very roasted and ashy. A bit too much roasted malts. Quite bitter. Long charcoal aftertaste.

20/07/2011 Open Baladin Roma (330ml bottle). Nera, densa, quasi impenetrabile, liquorosa, con cappello di schiuma grigiastra-marroncina, poco persistente. Aroma intenso e persistente di malti tostati con una netta e decisa botta di affumicato. In bocca è grezza senza compromessi, malti tostati, caffè, affumicato, una punta di alcol, forse un po troppo percettibile. Corpo medio, carbonazione corretta. Gran bella smoked stout.
A: smoked malts, herbs, grain A: black, deep and foamy T: strong smoked P: Fb, low carbo O: 20/20
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2013 Una delle migliori affumicate mai bevute. Parte leggerina ma ha una coda devastante, affumicatone senza pietà!
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured black with a beige head.  aroma and flavor were smoke, ham, and BBQ.  body was silky with low carbonation.

Bottle 33 cl batch 40-10 @ Domus Birrae (Rome, Italy). Wow, aspect of this beer is fantastic: black impenetrable body where a coffee-boiling point foam gives a charming head; after minutes foam vanishes, but leaves a thin trace over like a brown-beige sheet. Aroma is moderately smoked, a touch of ashes, then cocoa, burned wood, coffee grounds. Hints of resinous and yeast. Body is medium, well carbonated, maybe not so intense and flat a little (probably due to the 1 year aging), I found cocoa, elderberry, burned sugar, caramel. Finish is astringent, resinous and bitter just like a cup of good coffee; long lasting. Hoping to have a fresher one, but my opinion is positive meanwhile.
bottle, thanks to bu11zeye, black color with thick molasses, caramely aroma, flavor is sour chocolates, smoke, brown sugar , one of the best of the night

(330ml bottle, BB 30 01 13)  Pours an opaque black body with a spare tan head.  Aroma of roasted malt, vinous, plum, peat, tar, and smoke.  Flavor of smoke, dark chocolate, ash, and vanilla with a dry, bitter finish.   Nice smoked beer!

My Bottom Line:
Peat smoke, coffee beans and blackberry syrup delve into roastiness and grassy hops for a verbose Smoked Imperial Stout.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam surrounds the dark brown.
-Vinegary edges mar the linear nose.
-The body is sweet, but still healthy (neither heavy nor thin).
-The roasted malt profile in the finish and the prevalent fruitiness didnt quite agree.
-I was expecting better from Lambrate, especially since the regular Ghisa on tap was wonderful. I get the impression the bottle here was not at its best.

Bottle.

From bottle at the brewpub. Almost black with a beautiful, creamy, tan head. Moderately smoked and roasted malts aroma, hints of chocolate. More assertive smoked meats flavours, still with hints of chocolate. Well-made and somewhat original.
Pitch black body, brown head. Aroma of dark molasses, roasted malt, chocolate, hops ans dark fruits. Flavour has some smoke, roastiness and chocolate. Also burned candy.

Weich malziger Antrunk, der sehr trocken aber erstaunlich wenig rauchig ist. Weich bleibt das Bier auch im Mittelteil, die Rauchigkeit erhöht sich nicht mehr. So bleibt das Bier auf die süße und weiche Rauchigkeit beschränkt, dazu wenig hefig. Es fehlt eine herbe Richtung, das Bier wirkt schnell eintönig. 12/11/11/12/9/11

Bottle pulled by Manuele from the depths of the shared Bir&Fud and Makke cellar - grazie signore!  Shared with tarheels86 and the crowd of regulars.  Pours thick and brown, tan head.  Aroma of coffee grounds.  Taste is very subtle roast, lots of coffee and chocolate.  Nice.

330mL at Ma Che Siete in Rome. Stolen from the cellar at Bir&Fud. The pour is pretty much jet black with a massive, stout-like, sheen, thick, mocha head. Aroma is cheesecake, huge oil cured Beldi olives, strawberry dessert. Taste is tannic, oak, salty, berry skins. Palate is thinner and tannic. No smoke character.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2012 330 ml bottle. BBE 02/11. Batch #02 09. From Roma, Italy. Courtesy of Brandman.
Black colour with tiny light brown head.
Roasted malt, chocolate, cacao, ash, mild coffee and vanilla in aroma.
Flavour is more harsh with strong ash, dry roasted malt, mild coffee and berries. Theres no chocolatey sweetness in flavour. 

330 ml bottle. at the Birrificio Lambrate, Milan, Italy. L079011. BB 08/02/15.
Black colour with tiny tan head. 
Roasted malt, chocolate, ash, liquorice and hoppy bitterness in aroma. Liquorice dryness in flavour. Roasted malt. Rich and tasty.

Bottle from Domus Birrae, Rome. Pours deep amber almost black with a huge spongy mocca coloured head. Aroma is heavy roasted with notes of smoke, liquorice and wood.Low carbonation. Taste is heavy roasted, moderate bitter and roasted with a nice peaty smoked addition. Oily and sticky mouthfeel. Well hidden alcohol, a good crafted smoked.

Bottled 33cl. It pours a pitch black beer with a smallish creamy nicely lacing bubbly creamy deep beige head. Smoke, cress, burnt match, blackcurrant, licorice, diacetyl, caramel, manure, wood, leather, demerara and banana show up in the nose. Strong bitterness. Medium to full bodied. Low carbonation. Leathery. Dry smoky minty finish which is reminiscent of blackcurrant.

33cl bottle shared with friends.  Thanks Erik
Very dark beer.  Smokey taste.  Lovely beer
(botttled and shared wioth par) joku  väri jkpok iuj maku djoetu oiz gayt angastajg o jggjggjdfxcvjkgbsdflgjbsrd,

Bottled. Quite much pitch black colour, not much head. Aroma is smoked wood, some sweet malts, liquorice, some slight alcoholic sweetness. Flavour is smoked wet wood, roasted malts, some liquorice, mild dark dry fruits as well as some leathery notes.

Di colore nero profondo con  schiuma cappuccino fine e persistente. Esalta la tostatura ed i toni  affumicati della Ghisa. Ben fatta e piacevole, meno beverina della Ghisa tradizionale, ma senza eccessi.

@Mondial de la Bière 2010, Strasbourg - pitch black coloured with a little dark beige foam left; a solid but well-integrated smokiness; hints of bacon and vanilla, very complex; quite sweet initially, full-bodied, thick and very oily, very bitter and long coffeish smokey finish - beautiful

Bottle @ mondial de la bière. An amber beer with medium head. A sweet an malty beer, good body but with high diacetyl notes which are not bad but a bit heavy, this give a special overall caramel aroma. The smoked part is low, this beer is near a brow ale.

From the Bottle at the GBBF, Earls Court 04/08/2010
Big smoked aroma. Black very strong in alcohol rich on the palate and smoked with a hint of dryness in a full malt finish.

4th August 2010. GBBF.  Bottle opened by one of the nicest guys in the business - step forward Alex of Revelation Cat. Cheers Alex! Opaque balck beer, little tan head. Sweet dark malt with a little fruit. Decent and well joined up. Finishes semi dry.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Complex aroma, sweet, moccha, black currant and licorice, powerful. Opaque colour, brown firm head, good lace. Less complex flavour but still very nice. Easy going and light bodied. Smoked? Where? When?

Bottle thanks to Nate at the Imperial Geezer tasting, Borough Market.  Black, thick tan head.  Lots of dry malt.  Really roasted malt.  Lovely, I could drink lots of this.  Doesnt drink its strenght.  Great and a really solid beer.
Bottle from Doums Birrae. Tar, smoke, liquorice. velvety beer, pure enjoyment, but lacks the little extra to make it stand out.

A Mes rate. Bottle thanks hugely to Nate as part of the Imperial Geezer Tasting.Black body with a really good foamy tan head. Lots of black malt, slightly tarry and rubbery. Plenty of smoke and fruit. Dray, almost peaty finish. A very solid, high abv smoked beer.
bottle at RBESG 2010 ... ROME ... deep black ... smoked chocolate malts ... big smoke front ... some toffee ... light coffee ... good roast ...

On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti A Fa?, Rome. Pitch black pour with a creamy tan head. Roast, smoke, coffee and soy sauce in the aroma. The flavour is caramel, bitter hops, smoke, soy sauce and some roasted coffee.

Tap @ Ma Che Siete, Rome. Pours black with a small beige head and lacings. Nose is heavy roasted with a bit of tar and smoke. Low carbonation. Stikcy and oily. Heavy roasted flavor with peat, soy and smoke. Full bodied

Urco che bona la Imperial Ghisa del Lambrate, lho presa al Domus Birrae a Roma e pensare che manco la conoscevo; splendidamente affumicata ma ben bilanciata con un luppoletto resistente. Bellissima da vedere. Che cosè sto film su Telenapoli che incuriosisce?

In short: A smoky peaty chocolaty black beer.  Very nice.
How: Bottle 330ml.  Shared by/with the owner of Domus Birrae (Rome Italy) on location 
The look: Black body topped by a medium tan head
In long: Nose is dominated by a nice peaty smoke.  Body is smooth and velvety.  Taste is a mix of peat, black chocolate, smoke, cookies.  Each flavor element has its place, nothing dominates.  Nothing revolutionary here, but the execution is top-notch.  Ghisa is Italian for Cast Iron.  Remember that.  This could make all the difference in the world in a possible future blind-date with a smoking hot Italian metallurgical engineer.
Near black with a large deep beige head. Smoked aroma with hard roasted malt, smoke and coffee. Sweet flavour with hard roasted malt, coffee and smoke. Finished smoke.

On tap 8/29/09: Pours an oily opaque black with a well-lacing dark tan head.  Aroma of sweet smoky dark caramel and chocolate with a smooth dark fruity complexity.  Starts with a good full dark malty sweetness and complexity with rich dark chocolate flavor and a nice smoky balance.  An enjoyable smoked stout.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a big creamy brown head. Big impy stout nose - roasted malt, peat, coffee and chocolate. The flavour is crunchy roasted malt, dark bitter chocolate, coffee and smoke. Dry and roasty yet it has a creamy element about it. Solid body and big roasty finish. Tastes great!
33 cl bottle. Pours black with a creamy brown head. Aroma and taste are pretty complex: chocolate, coffee and clearly smoke. The end is bitter.Low carbonation. A good beer.

Bottle. Pitch black in appearance with a beautiful creamy brown head. Dry roasted malt aroma with slight smokey, chocolate and coffee notes. Dry roasted coffee. bitter chocolate and sweet malt flavour. Very creamy and delicious mouthfeel. Nice dry roasted and slightly bitter finish. Lovely.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2010 33cl bottle. Pours a cloudy dark brown body with a light brown head. Good lacing and mostly lasting foam. Aroma: heavily malty (cookies, bread, chocolate, coffee, roasted too), and moderate yeasty (earthy, yeah!). Wood and abviously smoke, too. Flavor is less complex then expected, but still intense and enjoyable: moderately sweet with a bitter finish. Smoke again, of course! Body is full and creamy. Medium-soft carbonation. The end lightly alcoholic, still easy drinkable. A great beer, surely better then expected.

Bottle from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Poured a pretty much black colour with a dark tan head that lingered a while. Nose and flavour was roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee,and of course smoke. The smokiness was not too overpowering though, and as such, the understatedness is something I really liked , as Im not the biggest fan of this style on the whole. Finished quite dry and bitter.  Good stuff.

tap at ølbaren.
dark brown, thick light brwn head.
aroma is roasted stuff, caramel, faint smoked note.
flavor is caramel, smoked and roasted stuff. Balanced, round, quite powerfull , ends roasted and malty, caramelly.
scura bella schiuma piuttosto persitente naso tostato caffe un po di luppolo buona intensita in bocca buon corpo note tostate intense caffe cioccolato forse un po di affumicato

Draught at Københavns Øldage 2009, Valby. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate and coffee aroma with some smoky hints. Roasted malty chocolate, coffee and smoke flavor with some bitter hints. Has a roasted malty chocolate and coffee finish with hints of smoke in the aftertaste.

Draught @ Ølfestival Valby - CBF09, Copenhagen, Denmark.Clear medium to dark black brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light brown head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, coffee - chocolate, smoke - peat. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20090516]
Draught at Ølbaren.Pitch black colour with creamy beige head.Aroma is rosted and moderate smoked.Strong aroma of dark chocolate and rosted malt,nice creamy mouthfeels and good full body.
Colore nero con cremosa schiuma bianca.Aroma affumicato,di malto tostato.IN bocca è corposa,ben bilanciata,con un forte gusto di cioccolato.Molto secca nel finale.Buona

Draught. Pitch Black colour with a nice dark brown head. Lovely aroma of roasted malt, smoke, chocolate and coffee. Good filling mouthfeel. The flavour has a very good roasty maltiness with coffee, smoke (not too much), liquorice and a pleasant dry bitterness. Long lasting dry roasty malty chocolate finish with some smoke. A light sourness was detected in this beer. Proberly because I was the first one to order from the tap that day.....

Draught. Highg creamy and lasting brown head. Pitch black body. Powerful coffee choccolate liquorice aroma. Flavor of coffee choccolate and liquorice plus a hint of mint. Nice strong hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long bitter aftertaste. Alcohol level seems just right.

On tap at Copenhagen Beerfestival. Its a jet black beer with a creamy, beige head that lasts. Roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and some smoke in the aroma. Not much sweetness going on, but maybe a bit much alcohol, considering its only 8.2% ABV. The flavor is roasted as well, with chocolate and some smoke. Not much hop flavor either, and the bitterness in the finish is of the roasted kind. Lasting for a good while too. Full-bodied and dry, and too warming. A lovely beer that would be even better with a toned down alcohol flavor. (090516)

Ink black with a veil of brown lasting foam.
The aroma is strong smoked, malty, roasted. Balanced, with a strong malt bitterness and very dry. Impressive bottom fermentation.

Draft. A pitch black beer with a brown head. The aroma has notes of malt as well as lighter notes of smoke, chocolate, and tar. The flavor is sweet malty combined with notes of roasted malt, smoke, and chocolate.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2010 On tap. Pours an opaque black with an off-white head. Hard roasted malt aroma. Quite full-bodied, sweetish hard roasted malt, some vanilla and dried fruit with an ashy edge. Dry malt bitter finish. 160509 and 040610

100ml served comfortably chilled on tap at the Italian exhibition stand, CBF 09. Very dark body with an initial beige head. Wooden dry to the nose. Rounded smoked character with blended dark malty depths. Bitter endnotes with a hint of yeast. Well made and intriguing (17.05.2009).
Draught. Black colour with a medium mostly lasting beige head. Rich aroma and taste of roasted malts and licorice with smoky notes.
KØ09. Cloudy black colour. Nice stable light brown head. Good flavourful beer. Nicely roasted. Mild roasted, a little coffee. Late pepper note.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2012 2012-04-12, bottle from Birratrovo, Como, 8.5%, bb 15-04-14, batch L046C 11, 8-5-9-5-17=44Black color, with creamy brownish head. Aroma of dark chocolate, rich, creamy, with hints of coffee. Good body strength, with wonderful chocolate flavor, mild smoke, traces of coffee and roasted malts (no liquorice); strong bitterness. Perfectly balanced, vibrant feelings. Fresh.Amazing.2009-05-16, draught at Københavnske Øldage 2009, 8.2% ABV, 7-4-8-4-15=38Black color; big creamy head. Light coffee aroma, good body, good chocolate flavor, light smoke, dry finish. Solid.
Sample at CPH beerfestival. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, licorice and smoke.

CBF09. Draught. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Roasted and nice licorice notes. Only slightly smoked. Long complex great finish. Exstremely great palate.
Draught at Københavns Øldage 2009, Valby. Black - brown head. Burned, fruity, smokey, sweetness, coffee, chocolate, dark chocolate, hard roasted, berries. A bit too simple - but nice.

Tap @ Ølfestival, Valby, 2009.
Pours completely black with a creamy, beige head. Nice lacing. Aroma is smoky and roasted malts. Creamy and dry mouthfeel. Flavour is a bit too meaty for me, heavy smoked, roasted malts and dark chocolate. Just too smoky.

CB09. From tap. Pours black with a slight tan head. Smoked and dark roasted malt aroma, very inviting. Dense tarish and roasted malt, smoked. Dark roasted to acidic flavoured into the far finish. Lovely.

Draught at Københavnske Øldage 2009.
Black coloured with a creamy and lacing beige head.
Roasted aroma of chocolate, ginger and spices.
Roasted flavour of dark chocolate with notes of liquorice and dried fruits.
Dry roasted finish.
Perfect flavor of the Weijermann smoek malt in this beer. Nice body and very good bitterness
